mbostock@gmail.com.message:
Fix polar clock example.

The shortest-path interpolation for HSL was causing all the bars to be the same
color. Switching to string-interpolation preserves the original behavior.

Merge branch 'transform-null' of git://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into 2.9.7

Conflicts:
	examples/transform/test-rotate.html
	src/core/interpolate.js

Don't use shortest-path for same-type transitions.

If the transform transition isn't the same type, then we can use the shortest-
path for rotate transitions. But, if the transforms are the same type, then we
should use the simpler string interpolation without the shortest-path.
Use shortest path even for large angles.
Use shortest path for rotate transitions.

Condense d3.interpolateTransform slightly.

Also, fix the transform rotate test.

Merge counties into MultiPolygons as needed.

Fixes #620. Also adds county names.

Beautify d3.v2.js.

The main advantage of beautification is that we can add abundant source comments
to the original files without increasing the size of d3.v2.js.
Merge branch 'date-2d' of git://github.com/jasondavies/d3 into fix-time-full-year

Fix #711 for years in the first century.

Alas, the JavaScript Date constructor is Y2K-centric.

Fix more bugs in circle clipping.

It was returning 0 rather than null when a feature was completely clipped, and
it was crashing when a closed polygon was completely clipped.

Optimize greatArc and circle.

When clipping, the origin of the great arc doesn’t change, so we can cache a
number of intermediate values and accelerate the clipping computation.

jason@jasondavies.com.message:
Update transform/test-rotate.

We no longer pick the shortest path for same type transitions.
Same type transforms: support matrix functions.
d3.bisect: support very large arrays.

More efficient handling of null transforms.

Avoid unnecessary object creation.

Add support for interpolating null transform lists.

For consistency with CSS3 [1], a null "from" or "to" transform list is
replaced by an identity function list whose types match those of the
non-null transform list.

[1]: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-transforms/#animation
Fix typo in comments: coallesce → coalesce.

Fixes custom timezone tests for Node.js 0.8.x.

The process.env.TZ trick no longer seems to work. The fix automatically
adds an offset to the minutes being set, relative to the current
timezone. It assumes that the dates being tested in the scope are not in
DST, since the offset is relative to the timezone offset at the epoch.

Fix and add tests for transition.filter.

Thanks, @mbostock!

Inherit ID, time and ease from parent transition.

Thanks, @mbostock!
Add missing file.
Clamp Math.sqrt to be on the safe side.

Further optimisation of d3.layout.pack.

Also avoids floating point errors without clamping, hopefully.

Minor optimisation for d3.layout.pack.

Uses the identity sin^2(x) + cos^2(x) = 1.
Add missing semicolon.

Add transition.filter. Fixes #726.

Behaves the same as selection.filter.
Minor optimisations to d3.interpolateTransform.

Retain d3.transform's public API.

That is, d3.transform is for decomposing a matrix.
Amend previous commit to use private methods.

Interpolate "same type" transforms in isolation.

For consistency with CSS3's 2D transforms, two transforms with the same
number of transform functions and corresponding functions of the same
type are treated differently: each transform function is interpolated in
isolation.

This allows us to interpolate many transforms that contain constant
functions in a more useful way, e.g.

  "rotate(<variable>)translate(<constant>)"

The variable rotation angle would now be linearly interpolated on its
own, keeping the constant translation vector constant.
Fix #720: d3.time.dayOfYear floating-point error.

Minor optimisation and Chrome bug workaround.

There appears to be a bug in Chrome causing the whole tab to crash when
setting svgNode.className.baseVal = "" for a newly-created element
without a non-empty class name:

  https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=138552

This fix is a minor optimisation: if the current class is empty then
removing a class should be a no-op.  It also conveniently works around
the Chrome bug.

Convert 2-digit years according to POSIX.

This is also the convention used by Python 1.5.2+. Values 69-99 are
mapped to 1969-1999, and values 0–68 are mapped to 2000–2068.

Don't interpret double-pan as double-tap.

Firstly, the last-touched-time was being set on touchend, even if a pan
gesture had occurred. This caused a pan quickly followed by a single tap
to be interpreted as a double-tap. In this fix, the time is only set on
touchstart.

Secondly, the time is cleared on touchmove, so that a pan gesture
cancels double-tap detection.
Add some unit tests for d3.geo.circle.
Only close clipped polygon if it is unclosed.

Fix #691: remove incorrect last interpolation step.

For closed polygons, the last point should simply be connected to the
first clipped point, rather than be clipped to the clipping circle.

steven.noble@gmail.com.message: properly declare my new variable (it was just a transcription error, really!)
an extension of monotonicity so that local minima and maxima in data are respected (that is the local maxima of the curve only occurs at the local maxima of the data)
slight error in the implementation of Cubic Hermite Splines

nate@calftrail.com.message: pass group index (and any potential other arguments in future) on to event handler
